intro: Bossiaea dentata var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrow-leaved bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are narrow and serrated, typically ranging from 2 to 5 centimeters in length. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as woodlands and heathlands. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that attract pollinators like bees and birds.
